question: 便秘
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: For this word, the <ja>便</ja> comes from <ja>便所</ja>, which you know as "toilet." A <kanji>toilet</kanji> <kanji>secret</kanji> is one you take with you to the bathroom, one that you don't want people to know about. This is <vocabulary>constipation</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own. The <ja>ひ</ja> changes to <ja>ぴ</ja> because "P" stands for "Poop."
